column4: Anyone else care to try and tackle this build problem I'm having? or possibly shed some insight?
with linux, by the time you right the book, it is already out of date.
I hear that.. I wish I had the technical skill to figure this out.. but i'm stumpped at the moment.. it's nothing critical  Just something I wanted to accomplish
I just jumped in, and caught your reference to docs, but I missed what your issue is.
I'm trying to complie KVM, the newest from sourceforge... I went by this howto, thats supposedly for edgy -- http://popey.com/Compiling_kvm_Under_Ubuntu_Edgy_i386
oops
anyway,, I went to that how to... followed step by step.. and up until make, everything matched, then this happened -- http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/1789/
Ok, I don't like living on the edgy, so I'm still using Dapper, but let me go look at your paste now.
ty ensign
! kvm
what is kvm? looks like your trying to compile it?
KVM is just a port of qemu, virtulazation software to let me run a couple windows programs.. well run windows xp in linux, like  vmware except supposedly only faster

I have used vmware in the past.. compiled it, if you call running the installer script compiling.. anyway it worked albeit slow, I was hoping kvm might allow my xp session a little better hardware support, like xen offers
I think somehow, I do not have a needed lib, or header installed, but have no idea where to start to figure it out
ok, it looks like the problem is in lines 33-35,
/lib/modules/2.6.17-10-386 is there.. but there is no build folder in that tree at all
do you have "build-essnitals" installed?
I thought I did, I sudo apt-get , let me check package manager and see if it shows them installed
corretcion, jb0nd38372: do you have "build-essentials" installed?
yes, package manager says its installed... sorry about that, too many open windows at the moment lol
I think I may have found a solution... brb,
